title: Memory Model

description.core_idea: Memory is a large sequence of addressable storage locations where data is stored as bytes.
explanation: A computer's memory can be imagined as a long row of boxes.
Each box has a unique address.
Each address stores a byte of data.
All higher-level data structures are built on top of this memory model.
key_points: Each memory location has an address
Data structures do not exist without memory

examples: An integer occupies multiple consecutive bytes in memory.
A variable name is just a label pointing to a memory address.
common_misconceptions: Variables store values directly instead of addresses
